title.narrative: CHRONIC UNDER-NUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2015, progress achieved in key areas of the Multisectoral Action Plan for the Reduction of Chronic Undernutrition, specifically infant and young child feeding and vitamin A supplementation/deworming

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Care for children with severe acute malnutrition
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
Salt iodization and other large-scale food fortification
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Vitamin A supplementation in early childhood (children under 5)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, progress achieved in key areas of the Multisectoral Action Plan for the Reduction of Chronic Undernutrition, specifically infant and young child feeding and vitamin A supplementation/deworming

description.narrative: Micro-nutrients supplementation coverage and nutritional rehabilitation enrolment increased in UNICEF targeted districts with the drought response accelerating action in a new set of districts. However, programme implementation was delayed and variable service quality remains, as well as gaps in food diversity. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:19/01/2017

title.narrative: Institutional mortality in children under 5 with severe acute malnutrition
% of children under 6 months who receive exclusive breastfeeding
Health facilities that provide SAM treatment services
% of children from 6 to 59 months who receive 2 doses of Vitamin A

actual.value: 2016:>85% of children received 1 dose. 20% received 2 doses (routine admin data for period June – October 2016)

title.narrative: Proportion of children 6-59 months old screened for acute malnutrition in (targeted) districts
